statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Northwestern St. 105, Houston Baptist 96
article.story: NATCHITOCHES, La. (AP) -- Trey Gilder and Damon Jones combined for 36 points, leading four double-digit scorers, as all 13 Northwestern State players notched points in a 105-96 win Tuesday over Houston Baptist. Gilder hit 8-of-10 shots from the floor, including his only 3-pointer, and added 3 assists and steals. Jones matched his season- and career-high with 17 points, making 3-of-5 from three-point range. Northwestern State (2-4) picked up 14 points and 9 rebounds from Colby Bargeman while Deividas Petravicius added 12 points. Houston Baptist (1-7), playing its sixth straight road game, got 27 points by Baron Sauls and 23 from Andrew Puzyk. The Huskies shot 51 percent from the floor and 42 percent (11-26) on 3-pointers, and chopped a 20-point deficit down to seven late in the game after the Demons opened a 50-34 halftime lead. The Demons shot 49 percent from the field, 48 percent (13-27) on 3-pointers and for the second straight game topped 80 percent on free throws (24-30). Last week, Northwestern State hit 25 of 30 in a 93-78 win over Ozarks. In the second half, Northwestern State was at 90-70, with 4:15 to play but the Huskies consistently cut into the league and drained three straight 3-pointers in the final 1:29 to get within 99-92 with 40 seconds to go. The Demons sank six straight free throws over the next 30 seconds to stem the rally.
